Sentence.sentence: The lawsuits said that the label was misleading because it gave the impression that the products had been certified by a third party when the certification was the company's own.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: No law required the involvement of a third party in certification.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It misled consumers to believe that its products had been certified by a third party.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It gave a third party the authority to label its products as environmentally friendly.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But that isn't why the government—under pressure from cancer charities, health workers and the Labour party—has agreed to legislate for standardised packaging.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: have placed religious beliefs above party politicshave bridged the gap between the rich and the pooroffer poor children more chances to climb the social laddersuffer from higher levels of racial and economic segregationFamily structure.

Sentence.sentence: In Paying for the Party, Hamilton describes what she calls the party pathway, which eases many students through college, helped along by various clubs that send students into the party scene and a host of easier majors.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For students who have been coasting through college, and for American universities that have been demanding less work, offering more attractions and charging higher tuition, the party may soon be over.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But the priorities of many undergraduates are with extracurricular activities, playing sports, and partying and socializing.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The Supreme Court is likely to persuade the parties concerned to work out a settlement.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It Includes third party insurance, but it's not include value-added tax, patrol or CDW.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Third party insurance only covers you for damage two another vehicle
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The 1976 copy right act has not prevented these abuses fully, but it has clarified the legal rights of the injured parties and given them an avenue for remedy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And now, if you'll walk this way, ladies and gentlemen, the next room we're going to see is the room in which the family used to hold their formal dinner parties and even occasionally entertain heads of state and royalty.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: It was used by the family to hold dinner parties
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Hello, my bathroom drain is blocked and I'm giving a party tonight.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Even parents who can see that a trip is little more than a party or celebration may well feel guilt that their child is left behind.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: I didn't drink, party, or even do much dating.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: In Paying for the Party, Hamilton describes what she calls the "party pathway", which eases many students through college, helped along by various clubs that send students into the party scene and a host of easier majors.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"宴会"之意。
means: banquet ： 指正式而盛大的宴会或国宴。
feast ： 指筵席酒席，有时可与banquet换用，但前者强调共享欢乐的气氛。
dinner ： 普通用词，含义广。本义指一日的主餐，但多用于指宴请客人的正式的一餐。
party ： 指一般的社交聚会，也引申指宴请或宴会。

example.en: We all helped in the GI party after dinner.
example.zh: 饭后，我们大家都参加了大扫除。

list.explanation: (总与a连用)某人(即我不希望提及其名，而你却可猜着此人是谁)

example.en: I spoke to a certain party about the matter you mentioned.
example.zh: 关于你所提及的事，我已对某人说过了。

sentences.en: The party was fresh in her memory.
sentences.cn: 那次聚会在她脑海中记忆犹新。

sentences.en: The party split up into small groups.
sentences.cn: 该党分裂为若干小派系。

sentences.en: The parties to the dispute should be more polite to each other.
sentences.cn: 争执双方应相互礼貌些。

means.word_mean: （一起旅行或参观等的）群，队，组</seg>

lj.lj_ly: the manipulations I'd been party to.
lj.lj_ls: 我曾经参与过的那些操作。

entry.def: A party is a political organization whose members have similar aims and beliefs. Usually the organization tries to get its members elected to the government of a country.
A party is a social event, often in someone's home, at which people enjoy themselves doing things such as eating, drinking, dancing, talking, or playing games.

example.ex: The couple met at a party...
example.tran: 那对情侣是在一个派对上认识的。

example.ex: We threw a huge birthday party...
example.tran: 我们举办了盛大的生日聚会。

entry.def: If you party, you enjoy yourself doing things such as going out to parties, drinking, dancing, and talking to people.

example.ex: They come to eat and drink, to swim, to party. Sometimes they never go to bed...
example.tran: 他们来吃喝、游泳、狂欢，有时都不睡觉。

example.ex: After a long evening of partying he looked tired.
example.tran: 纵情狂欢了一夜后，他看起来累了。

entry.def: A party of people is a group of people who are doing something together, for example travelling together.

example.ex: They became separated from their party.

entry.def: One of the people involved in a legal agreement or dispute can be referred to as a particular party.

example.ex: It has to be proved that they are the guilty party.
example.tran: 必须证明他们是过错方。

entry.def: Someone who is a party to or is party to an action or agreement is involved in it, and therefore partly responsible for it.

example.ex: Crook had resigned his post rather than be party to such treachery.
example.tran: 克鲁克已经辞职了，不愿参与这种背信弃义的行为。

means.word_mean: 1. an organization to gain political power;

sentences.sentence: "in 1992 Perot tried to organize a third party at the national level"

means.word_mean: 2. an occasion on which people can assemble for social interaction and entertainment;

sentences.sentence: "he planned a party to celebrate Bastille Day"

means.word_mean: 3. a band of people associated temporarily in some activity;

sentences.sentence: "they organized a party to search for food"
"the company of cooks walked into the kitchen"

means.word_mean: 4. a group of people gathered together for pleasure;
5. a person involved in legal proceedings;
1. have or participate in a party;

sentences.sentence: "The students were partying all night before the exam"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a body of people united in opposition to others, also in sense 2): from Old French partie, based on Latin partiri 'divide into parts'. Sense 1 dates from the early 18th cent
Middle English (in the sense 'particoloured'): from Old French parti 'parted', based on Latin partitus 'divided into parts' (from the verb partiri)

sentences.en: We nust have Lord and Lady Redcliff down for our next house party.

sentences.en: Prioritize work? related parties and attend only the most important ones.

sentences.en: We had a stupendous time at the party.

sentences.en: He often takes part in sociable parties to make more friends.

sentences.cn: 如果男士和女士一起参加社交聚会, 通常是由男士来买单.
sentences.en: If there are men and women in the party, the men usually pay.

sentences.en: She was shocked by his gross behaviour at the party.

sentences.cn: 玛丽为参加社交聚会而打扮好了.
sentences.en: Mary has done herself up for the party.

sentences.en: She loves giving parties and does so whenever she can find an excuse.

sentences.en: Geoffrey Hampden has a large circle of friends and is very popular at parties.

sentences.en: She is always a great draw at social parties.

sentences.en: The party was a drag, so we left early.

sentences.en: I believe I have the abilities to organize a party.

sentences.en: He loves parties; he is always the first to come and the last to leave.

sentences.cn: 如果你不喜欢聚会的气氛, 你可以离开啊.
sentences.en: If you don't like the atmosphere in the party, you take a powder.

sentences.cn: 她生动地介绍了那一聚会的情形.
sentences.en: She gave an exuberant account of the party.

sentences.cn: [ 单身汉聚会的目的何在 ]?
sentences.en: She asked, " What was the purpose of a stag party? "

sentences.cn: 他很冷漠地拒绝了参加办公室聚会的邀请.
sentences.en: Standoffishly, he declined the invitation to the office party.

sentences.cn: 别因为我把聚会的时间推迟了.
sentences.en: Don't put off the party on my account.

sentences.cn: 玛丽病了,这使参加聚会的人很扫兴.
sentences.en: Mary's illness cast a damp over the party.

sentences.cn: 一定要参加我的生日聚会的, 尤其重要的是要准时.
sentences.en: Be sure to come to my birthday party, and above all, be punctual.

sentences.cn: 玛丽和我不是一道去参加聚会的.
sentences.en: Mary and I went to the party separately.

sentences.cn: 把冰箱从温尼贝戈人那里拿回来,在聚会的时候送给她.
sentences.en: Get the reefer out of the Winnebago and give it to her during the party.

sentences.cn: 他善于安排聚会的各项事宜.
sentences.en: He is good at getting things up for parties.

sentences.cn: 我们希望所有客人都带着对这次聚会的愉快的回忆离去.
sentences.en: We hope to send all our guests away with pleasant memories of the party.

sentences.cn: 参加聚会的人很多.
sentences.en: There was a large attendance at the party.

sentences.cn: 现在我是那个被邀请参加那个仁慈聚会的人.
sentences.en: Now I'm the one invited along to the pity party.

sentences.cn: 如果和我的时间表不冲突的话,我会去那个聚会的.
sentences.en: I will go to the party if it doesn't clash with my schedule.

sentences.cn: 聚会的准备工作很早就开始了.
sentences.en: Preparation for the party started early.

sentences.cn: 一直到早上4点聚会的人群才渐渐散去.
sentences.en: The party didn't die down until about four in the morning.

sentences.cn: 你什么时候离开聚会的?
sentences.en: When did you come away from the party?

sentences.cn: 是商务宴请和社交聚会的理想所选.
sentences.en: It is available for special occasions, VIP guests and personal parties.

sentences.cn: 聚会的时候该穿些什么?
sentences.en: What is the dress code for the party?

sentences.cn: 他们引入欧洲网络交友 、 聚会的模式.
sentences.en: They introduce a European network of friends, party mode.

sentences.cn: 她拐弯抹角地想弄到那个聚会的请柬.
sentences.en: She was angling for an invitation to that party.

sentences.cn: 中心还提供给孩子们聚会的场所, 一座咖啡厅, 包间和露天电视室.
sentences.en: The centre also offers facilities for children's parties, a cafe, mezzanine and Sky TV room.

sentences.cn: 我们共同的美国梦将超越政党和党派的支持者.
sentences.en: And that our shared American ideals will always transcend political parties and partisanship.

sentences.cn: 两个党派被共同的利益联系在一起.
sentences.en: The two parties were linked together by common interest.

sentences.cn: 一群为了共同的目的聚在一起的人.
sentences.en: An alliance of persons or parties for a common purpose association.

Sentence.sentence: Veiseh can even put a date on when those tapes started recording: 15 December 2000, when he met his first girlfriend at his best friend's 16th birthday party.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: You probably think college students are experts at sleeping,  but parties, preparations for tests, personal problems and general stress can wreck a student’s sleep habits, which can be bad for the body and the mind.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Shouldn't preparing—and consuming—food be a source of comfort, pride, health, well-being, relaxation, sociability? Something that connects us to other humans? Why would we want to outsource ( ' , 外包 ) this basic task, especially when outsourcing it is so harmful? When I talk about cooking, I'm not talking about creating elaborate dinner parties or three-day science projects.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As well as the background checks carried out by platform owners, online reviews and ratings are usually posted by both parties to each transaction, which makes it easy to spot bad drivers, bathrobe-thieves and surfboard-wreckers
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: seven robberies and about 60 other violent attacks, most of these involving fights at parties.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Forgive the mess in here, we have a party last night.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: She has to invite David to the party
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Are such accusations simply efforts to score political points for one's party?
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Come to think of it, my parents did throw her a surprise party that year.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Don't worry, you are most welcome to join our party, and as I always say "the more, the merrier".
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Everyone loves a good house party, but the cleaning-up the next morning isn't as enjoyable.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section A
